DOC.brief_title: TELESTAR ( Telotristat Etiprate Somatostatin Analogue Not Adequately Controlled Carcinoid Syndrome )
DOC.criteria: Histopathologicallyconfirmed , welldifferentiated metastatic neuroendocrine tumor Documented history carcinoid syndrome currently experience ≥4 bowel movement per day Runin period Currently receive stabledose somatostatin analog ( SSA ) therapy Minimum dose LAR depot SSA therapy Octreotide LAR 30 mg every 4 week Lanreotide Depot 120 mg every 4 week Patients tolerate SSA therapy level indicate allow enter high tolerate dose Ability willingness provide write informed consent Presence diarrhea attribute condition ( ) carcinoid syndrome Karnofsky Performance status ≤60 % Treatment tumor direct therapy , include interferon , chemotherapy , mTOR inhibitor ≤4 week prior Screening , hepatic embolization , radiotherapy , radiolabelled SSA , and/or tumor debulking ≤12 week prior Screening History short bowel syndrome ( SBS ) Clinically significant cardiac arrhythmia , bradycardia , tachycardia would compromise patient safety outcome study , QTcF > 450 m Previous exposure telotristat etiprate
